title: I have a claim against me from Wilber and associates for $7874.24 and I exactly dont have the money for that.
question: I got into a car accident earlier in May 2015 for having no insurance driving my friends car and the insurance company worked it out but now sent me a subrogation letter and now demanding money from me...im unemployed and currently have no income, what can i do?
answers: If you're insolvent consider filing for bankruptcy protection. A bankruptcy filing may have major consequences on your credit, however you (a) do not seem to be disputing liability for the debt and (b) are unable to pay the debt.

Wilber & Associates may be willing to work out payment terms with you if you inform them of your situation. Sometimes its worth investing in some attorney time on auto subrogation claims and sometimes it doesn't make sense economically. Another option is Bankruptcy.
You may want to consult with a bankruptcy attorney.
